GET /.description: serves a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /products.description: serves an array of all products

products.title: Abacus
products.description: A wooden abacus that will help teach counting skills

GET /products/:id.description: serves an object of a product of the given ID

product.title: Abacus
product.description: A wooden abacus that will help teach counting skills

POST /products.description: accepts an object of a new product and returns it

exampleRequestBody.title: A new product
exampleRequestBody.description: This is shiny and brand new

product.title: A new product
product.description: This is shiny and brand new

PATCH /products/:id.description: accepts an object containing product fields to update and returns the updated product

exampleRequestBody.title: A fairly new product
exampleRequestBody.description: This is shiny and quite new

product.title: A fairly new product
product.description: This is shiny and quite new

DELETE /products/:id.description: removes the product of the given ID from the database

GET /categories.description: serves an array of all categories

categories.category_description: Home is where the heart is, so find products that you love

GET /categories/:id.description: serves an object of a category of the given ID

POST /categories.description: accepts an object of a new category and returns it

exampleRequestBody.category_description: Is it technology or is it magic?

category.category_description: Is it technology or is it magic?

PATCH /categories/:id.description: accepts an object containing category fields to update and returns the updated category

exampleRequestBody.category_description: You're never too old to play

category.category_description: You're never too old to play

DELETE /categories/:id.description: removes the category of the given ID from the database
